name: Fistral Beach Hotel and Spa

reviews.text: We took 8 rooms as part of a corporate trip and thought it was excellent. Didnt use the spa but bar / restaurant was good (basic food but well executed) and clean, newly refurbished rooms with good showers / bath. Excellent staff. Would happily stay again.
reviews.title: Great stay, fabulous views, helpful staff

reviews.text: I've been coming to Cornwall ever since I was born and know the area very well. So when I say, it's the best place to stay in Newquay, it comes with conviction! Simply whenver I come down, I always stay here. It's just on the edge of Newquay, so you're away from all the riff raff, and in one of the most beautifl parts of Cornwall with an amazing view of Fistral Beach.
reviews.title: Simply best place to stay in Newquay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are very news and spotless, the thing that makes this hotel though is the staff. They can't do enough to help you and are very friendly
reviews.title: Average certainly not as luxury as announced

reviews.text: Looking forward to going back
reviews.title: Couldn't fault it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a room with see view and we had the see view but also in this mini room view on the bar and the parking!
reviews.title: Nice hotel. Skip the SPA.

reviews.text: We stayed at this lovely hotel whilst on coach trip. What a super place! The staff were friendly and always smiling and helpful. How nice it is to have a smiling waiter or waitress serving your meal. The meals were excellent too. Our room was large with a very good bathroom. The beds were comfortable. We enjoyed every aspect of this hotel and it really deserves being number one.
reviews.title: So comfortable. Couldn't ask for a wrong thing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had previously stayed here a few years ago and enjoyed it so much we have always wanted to stay again. So, when he offer came up of three nights for the price of two we took advantage and booked up.
reviews.title: Heven on Earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were not disappointed, the rooms which had been modernised, were clean, bright, spacious and tastefully furnished and had a comfortable king-size bed. The adjoining bathroom was roomy, clean and had an excellent bath suite.
reviews.title: Our 5 day stay at the hotel whilst on Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The public areas were equally good as the bedrooms, everything was clean and smart and tastefully furnished.
reviews.title: A true gem of Cornwall

reviews.text: Staff were always on hand and were courteous at all times.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: Stayed 8th September for my birthday. We booked the Sunday night Spa package - £189 for 2 people, this includes double room with sea view, all day use of pool, jacuzzi/hot tub etc, 3 course evening meal, breakfast and 2 hours of treatments. We arrived at 11.30 and went in the bar for lunch and drinks we hoped seeing as our spa day started at 10am that we may of had our room ready before 2pm so that we could settle in, bit that was disappointingly not possible. The pool and steam room and hot tub are lovely, and changing rooms clean although over flowing with finished towels. Really disappointed that there were no loungers by the pool to lie and chill and read. We went up to have treatments facial which was very good and Leanne was very lovely. My partner had a massage which he said was fantastic. We went into the relaxation room but this is up on the third floor ~ pool is on ground floor , and all beds were in use which meant the whole day at the spa I had no where to lie down and read. The cocktails were not cheap but tasted amazing. The lunch was lovely, and evening meal was good. However, they had run out of all roast dinners and the pork loin and my partner would of loved a pasta dish but they only had pasta with fish on the menu. Also the special dessert had run out. The food we had was nice but my deep fried Brie had to be returned as was chilly in the middle. Breakfast was buffet and cooked which was really nicely cooked. All staff were helpful and friendly in all departments. Room was fantastic, modern and had a large bathroom up some steps from the bedroom with patio doors to a balcony. Stunning view of fistral beach from the balcony and in the bath!! Unfortunately the sea kept me awake but that's just me! The bed was lush comfortable. All in all a great hotel for breaks, but my few niggles did ruin my birthday treat a little bit :-/
reviews.title: Nice retreat modern hotel with excellant facilities, rooms and views

reviews.text: We stay at this hotel for a weekend getaway, booked through spa breaks. The hotel its self was lovely... well decorated and clean, and the staff were lovely and polite. Our main complaint is that on returning to our room, (which we had left a do not disturb sign on anyway) we found our door had been left open so you could just push it and walk in. Obviously this is a security risk as we had left valuables in our room, fortunately nothing was taken, but I then felt it was unsafe and had to drag stuff about with us. We complained to reception and to be fair the receptionist was very polite and apologised and we was given a voucher for a free drink... however I do not think a free drink covers it as it should not of happene i the first place.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but a few improvements needed

reviews.text: The spa treatments were brilliant and therapists were very nice. Food was lovely although both days we found ourselves sitting and waiting for our order to be taken for over 20minutes.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: Overall we thought our trip was overpriced for what we got (however this may be because we booked through a third party) compared to other spa breaks we have take. The views from our room were amazing though . Due to the ssecurity problem we had with our room I would not return to this hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect stay... Thank you!

reviews.text: Really superb hotel - without exception the staff were brilliant and so helpful and happy. We did find the vouchers very confusing (20% off dinner but then we didn't get the voucher back; 15% off the spa but not for packages which are also called programmes). Other than that it was faultless!
reviews.title: Fab stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our second visit. We had a Seaview room,which was a really good size,also the bathroom had a lovely freestanding bath and a walk in rainfall shower. All was modern and lovely and clean.
reviews.title: Could not stop smiling to ourselves all weekend,loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a spa package with a 55 minute massage, which was amazing! The Breakfast Menu had great choice of just about anything you could want for breakfast and the Evening meal was Three Course A La Carte. All food was superb!!.
reviews.title: Relaxing, Romantic Escape!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Add to this, Staff that are really welcoming and heplful,nothing is too much trouble for any of them,and you know why we will be going back again and again.
reviews.title: Highly recommended!
Excellent
reviews.text: Oh,and the Gym was well equiped and maintained and the Pool, Sauna, Steamroom,and Jacuzzi well looked after. The changing rooms, nice and clean, with a plentiful supply of fresh towels and shower gels.

We have been visiting this hotel for about 7 yrs now (we only live 45 mins away) and it just gets better everytime!! We both have very busy lifestyles with work and kids so to come here and totally relax and unwind is amazing. We booked the couples package which included DBB, champagne and chocolates on arrival, 90 minute treatment in the spa and stayed in one of there 'best rooms' with a sea view and balcony. Well I cannot fault anything!! We love the new refurb - the food, both evening and breakfast were outstanding, and the staff are so lovely and helpful. I could go on praising this hotel but I think I have covered all the main points!! Oh the only problem we had was the room was so hot and that was with no heating on so we slept with the balcony door open and listened to the sea all night!!! Perfect!
reviews.title: simply excellent

description: Directly overlooking Fistral Beach, with 4 Silver stars we are officially the highest rated Hotel in Newquay. Our award winning Fistral Spa is also the highest rated Spa in Cornwall on Tripadvisor. We are a fun, stylish and contemporary hotel with excellent rooms, food, facilities and service. But enough of our corporate blurb, just read our reviews, visit our website, decide for yourself, then check in and chill out here at Fistral Beach Hotel and Spa.
